Reviews.Title: “Richmond Hotel Rome - Feb 2012”
Reviews.Author: Bristolians55plus
Reviews.Content: 4-night stay in this hotel advertised as a 4* antique treasure. It is being refurbished. The old part is in a poor state. The first room offered was really grubby and barely worthy of 2*. The carpets and chairs were stained and worn out years ago. Parts of the bath surface were missing. The second room offered was in the modern half of the hotel; much better but small and only 3* value. The bathroom flooded with every shower. Big disappointment. Good position (<500m from Colosseum). Continental breakfast on outdoor roof terrace (which needed its wind protection in place in February) was reasonable but nothing special. Location is on south side of road, not north side as shown on Google maps.

Reviews.Title: “Lapo & Fabio made up for the inconveniences!”
Reviews.Author: sunshinebaptiste
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a run of the mill room, this place will do. Although the A.C. wasn't working in my room, Fabio upgraded me to one of the newer suites on the updated end of the hotel and boy what a HUGE difference! The newer room is quite nice and very modern vs. the traditional room I had the night before. I must say, the older wing could use quite a revamp too! Wonder if the owner will get around to that... nevertheless, I had a wonderful experience as the front desk receptionists, Lapo and Fabio, were OUSTANDING and went above and beyond the call of duty to ensure that my stay was pleasant. Honestly, I truly believe they run the joint where their rude colleague fell short, they stepped in. As a solo traveler, it felt like I had a personal concierge at my beckon call. Everything was taken care of, from my transport, to local eateries, getting around, and personal requests too you name it and the fellas took special care. A very special thank you for making my stay in Rome an especially pleasant one and one that I'll remember always.

Reviews.Title: “Fab lunch...”
Reviews.Author: sweet_avalanche
Reviews.Content: We were in Rome for just one night, after 3 weeks in Tuscany! Wonderful! We stayed at Hotel Nerva, just up from the Colloseum. Really wonderful hotel. We had an early evening flight, and so headed for lunch. Decided on restaurant Angelino Al Fori. It was wonderful. We are a family of 2 adults and 3 kids and we were very pleased with food and service. The waiters are authentic, although they do play up to the tourist, but were good fun! Food was really good, and very well priced. We would go back for dinner if in Rome again. A little gem, with great ambience! Loved it...

Reviews.Title: “Happy with the hotel, and great staff”
Reviews.Author: Kashifinho
Reviews.Content: This hotel room came for a good price. It was quite clear that they had been doing construction work, but apart from a mazey route to my room, i didn't notice it. My room overlooked the main road which is noisy and the window didn't keep out the noise as much as i wanted. But, I was doing so much walking each day that I slept like a baby each night. If I had kids with me, I might think twice about this hotel. Location wise it is GREAT. The colosseum is right around the corner. The main train station and Piazza della Repubblica are about 15 minutes walk away, and it has good transport links. The staff were fabulous with great tips on how to get to where i wanted, places to visit, places to eat. If I go to Rome again on my own, I will definitely check stay in this place.

Reviews.Title: “Horrid”
Reviews.Author: Hawk80126
Reviews.Content: Make sure you aren't in the "old" part. 1 star at best. I would've rather camped!!

Reviews.Title: “Spend your time and money elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: Cri711
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews and took a chance. BIG mistake! The pictures are extremely misleading! The hotel is under construction, however they are still charging top $$ for the unrenovated rooms. The A\C never got below 78 degrees F (my in- laws did not work at all). The bathroom and room smelled like mold/musty, the wallpaper is peeling, the 2'x2 shower leaked everywhere. Even the view photos on the website are clearly photoshopped. The list goes on and on. THE only good thing about the hotel is the close proximity to the Colleseum. However, I would have paid a few extra Euros to have a relaxing hotel to return to at the end of a long day of sight-seeing. The Richmond Hotel is not it!

Reviews.Title: “Quite a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Crego85
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Richmond is in a very good location. At the moment is undergoing some refurtishment work and the bedroom was obviously one of the older, shabbier ones. It was comfortable except for very loud air conditioning. I was baffled when I paid the bill that I also had to pay a 'city tax' of €9 in cash,. There was no mention of that in the booking confirmation I received. I saw an American couple similarly bemused - not so much by the amount as by the fact it had to be paid in cash. Other hotels do not seem to have a similar policy.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, With Good Service That Should Improve In Time”
Reviews.Author: Clumsyricks
Reviews.Content: Overall, our stay was pleasant with a few inconveniences. Would have probably graded higher if not for price and four-star rating. This hotel is in the midst of expanding. It bought the building next door and knocked down a wail to connect the two on one hall. The old rooms are completely different then the new rooms (we saw both). Our experiences below are based on the new rooms: Pros: Location- very close to Forum, Coll., Palatine and other ruins as well as Capitoline Museums. Longer walk to more touristy areas like Campo di Fiori, but even Vatican (furthest walk) is only 20 minutes or 10-15 by metro. New rooms- nothing like a brand new, modern room! Ultra clean and fresh. Service- other than some miscommunication before we arrived, the staff were very willing to do whatever was necessary to ensure our stay was a happy one. Very helpful. Cons: Rooms- while the rooms in the new building are ultra new, some were not designed well. One shower flooded the bathroom (we had to move rooms) and that same room felt very small based on design (setup, layout, window location, etc). Also, there are still some rough edges, like a missing ceiling panel in one room (but not others), bedroom mirror and refrig missing on another, etc. Some of this is a work-in-progress and I expect will be corrected in time. Some, such as the design, won't. But this would be a very minor detraction over all. Breakfast- adequate and with a very nice location on roof, but for a four-star hotel I would expect more variety and better croissants. We stayed at many hotels last month in Italy, including one other four star and many three stars and Richmond's breakfast low on the list. Parking- there is none. Certainly not a problem if you arrive/leave by cab, but if you were driving in and then returning the car, it was difficult. There is a narrow driveway between restaurants that happened to be open, but otherwise you would have to park on a very busy street where no parking is really allowed. This is actually rather typical for Rome, except we were led to believe the location was fine for parking and unloading. Again, rather minor issue if you are aware before arriving.

Reviews.Title: “dont believe the pictures”
Reviews.Author: cd2523
Reviews.Content: So the hotel is ok, but the ad photos have been taken with good lighting and angles. In actuality although our rooms were spacious being 'superior rooms' the decor is faded with dingy lighting. Run down chintz really. The amenities are adequate as a whole but we did have a few problems. Our bath had no plug and we regularly flooded the bathroom as the shower door didn't make a proper seal with the bath. The AC in my sisters room was excellent, the room felt like a fridge but our AC could actually constitute a health hazard, disgustingly filthy inside and rattled constantly. The breakfast terrace is lovely, although with a hideous statue made I think of paper mache. Location wise this place is perfect and the staff are extremely helpful and friendly. I just feel that to qualify for 4 stars and be worth the price you pay the interior needs a big overhaul. Until then I think you can definately find better hotels for cheaper prices.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: rockstar3434
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Richmond in April 2008 with my family. We were given a suite on the first floor. Our room was spacious with large windows allowing natural light in. The room and bathroom were cleaned regularly and overall we found it to be very comfortable. My sister got sick during the trip and the staff brought tea to our room for free. The breakfast area is on the roof with nice views of the surrounding area. The hotel is across from the Roman forum and a short walk to other sights and a Metro stop is nearby. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: TravellingDans
Reviews.Content: The location only minutes from the Roman Forum and Colosseum is fantastic, but this also means that there is a lot of traffic noise at all hours of the day. The hotel will kindly issue you with ear plugs so you can get some sleep. It is clean, the view from the hotel’s rooftop terrace of the Forum as you breakfast is amazing, it is easy to get to from the main train station or by the metro, it is a convenient base to explore the rest of Rome, and the hotel staff are helpful and friendly. But like most hotels in Rome I’ve stayed in, you can’t help feeling it’s overpriced. The bathroom is tiny, especially the shower. I’m only 5’3’’ and I still had trouble turning around in it. The hot water takes about 2-3 minutes to come on from when you turn on the taps. The rack to hang your clothes in the wardrobe is so high that I had to stand on a chair. My mind is still boggling over how to open and use the safe. And I’m sure the view from my window would have been fantastic if I was able to open the shutters and see it! I had to push them out to the point where the clasp was held and could just make it out through the gap between and below the shutters. But overall, the experience at Richmond was cosy. After 8 days I felt very much at home. There are lots of restaurants right next door that are really good, and who can complain when such history is on your doorstep?

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD”
Reviews.Author: Rmurro
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. It's near from Colisseu, Piazza Navona and many restaurants and stores. The staff is absolutelly above average. The rooms are very comfortable and clean. There's a roof restaurant where you can have your brakfast and appreciate the landscape of Rome. I really recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location near Forum, great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AvidTravelingFamily
Reviews.Content: We chose Hotel Richmond based upon its wonderful location right next to the Forum and the pictures of its beautiful rooftop breakfast terrace! We were not disappointed! Our family of three includes a 6'3" sixteen-year-old son, so we were alittle worried about space, but we were given a lovely triple room with enough room to move around and a comfortable bed for our son. The high ceilings were ornately painted and we could either open the windows or use the air-conditioner. The shower was strong and hot water was plentiful, and everything was thoroughly clean! Great value for money in a city with very expensive hotels. Although we used Booking.com to reserve the room, we emailed to confirm and got some wonderful advice from Gemma at reception. She was such a help to us -- arranging for our pick-up at the airport, restaurant reservations, taxis, etc! We looked forward to breakfast each day on the terrace which has a great view! All the normal continental breakfast items were available -- including fresh croissants and fruit (along with eggs that could be added for a bit extra $). It was a great start to the day! We felt we could walk virtually anywhere from our location very near Piazza Venezia. And there's even a terrific pizzeria just outside the front of the hotel along with a great source for gelato! Highly recommended over all!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - a Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Susan1958
Reviews.Content: I just spent a week at the Hotel Richmond and found the location perfect for visiting the ancient sites. The staff could not have been more accommodating. The room (a single) was small, but very comfortable (with a bed that satisfied even my bad back) and spotless. The bath was tiny, but it certainly didn't bother me. Breakfast on the roof terrace was a treat each morning, with an excellent choice of food and good coffee. The only negatives are (a) the traffic noise from a busy intersection, although the double glazed window shut it out well, and (b) the rather weak air conditioning. I was on the cusp of being uncomfortably warm at night and would suggest to the hotel that they either upgrade the A/C or provide fans. I would recommend the Richmond highly.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location,Location.”
Reviews.Author: varvoom
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is located smack bang at centre of all the historical sites I was intending to visit, situated at bottom end of Via Cavour. The highlight of my stay were the excellent service given by Janet and Gemma, they speak good English and were ever so helpful for directions, best place to eat and mainly the added comfort that I feel I’m being sincerely looked after and cared without being prompt. I emailed them before I flew over after having read on this site that their single room may be too tiny for me and hope they could upgrade me if they were not too busy. Being their off season, well, to my surprise I was upgraded without paying any extra. Room and bathroom were very clean albeit peely wall paper could be improve. Pictures of the room, the scene in front of my room (303) and Gemma are all being attached. Roman forum and the back of the original Senate building was right in front of my window, the coliseum is not visible but it’s at the back of the hotel, statue of the Emmanuelle is also visible. If you are sensitive to traffic noise there are even ear plugs supplied, being at the centre of all the historical site these was expected. Breakfast was served on the roof top, but since it is winter, a plastic canopy with garden gas heater was installed to keep the worst of the cold away, what a view it could be if it is during the summer. There is WiFi available; costing 2.50 euro per ½ hour, cheaper if you buy longer time, which I felt should be free. There is a tiny fridge with refreshments available, a bottle opener but no cock screw, have to ask for one to open my bottle of wine. Plug adapter to top up my camera battery was luckily also available. A wall safe and flat screen sky TV sum up the facilities of the room. Nearly forgot, didn’t like a petrol station in front of the hotel. This hotel don’t have lunch nor dinner for their patron but there are numerous eateries in the surrounding area to choose from, many along Via Madonna, Monti and Leonina, being off the beaten track, in front of the hotels, are little Roman eateries to indulged in, my favourite is call Traterre Romana but it seem all these good eateries where Roman eat are only open between 12-3pm and 7-10pm. Along Via Leonina, Finnegan pub give you a sense of being home away from home i.e. if you are from UK. If I’m going to Rome again I’m not going through the whole mundane business of checking out all the other hotels because I found one. .Thank you Gemma and Janet.

Reviews.Title: “Bellisimo”
Reviews.Author: Gondolier
Reviews.Content: Buon giorno! We went to Rome as a large family group to celebrate a ruby wedding in March for 4 nights. The Richmond hotel could not have been a better choice, brilliant location and very helpfull staff. Fabulous selection of food for breakfast on the roof terrace, with fantastic views across Rome. The Roman forum and colosseum was just a spit away as was the "Shammrock" irish bar around the corner (highly recommended). Rome is very compact and all attractions are in walking distance (managed by all 3 generations), no need to use public transport. Trevi fountain, Piazza Navona, Spanish steps, Colosseum, Pantheon and of course St Peters are all must see places. We even saw the Pope on his Sunday sermon from his appartment window. Can recommend climbing to the top of St Peters dome for the best view across Rome, dont worry about the que, they soon go down, and watch out for the sloping roof towards the top. A good read before you go to Rome is Dan Browns "Angels and Demons" Arrivederci

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but AC Sucks”
Reviews.Author: TedGainesville_FL
Reviews.Content: This could be a much nicer hotel if they would put some money into the AC system. Carlo was a great manager, but he is gone now. I have stayed here 3 times and while worth the money, I would not recommend it in the summer time. The roof top is open for breakfast and it is quite nice to sit up there at night (great privacy) and eat a pizza and have a drink.

Reviews.Title: “Location is everything”
Reviews.Author: capri30
Reviews.Content: You cannot get any closer to the Forum and the Coliseum. And it's an easy walk to the Trevi fountain, Pantheon and Spanish steps. It also satisfied our family of four with a queen bed and two singles. This was hard to find in Rome. Everything was clean and worked. Breakfast was simple, but again satisfying. The staff was courteous, but not to eager. If your idea of a hotel is a place to sleep and shower, then this a good choice. You can see a lot of Rome from here with no transportation costs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: kaperin0
Reviews.Content: My husband, eighteen year old son, his freind and I, stayed at the Richmond Rorma post Cruise on June the 18th thru the 21st. The Hotel is a family oriented, small , well maintained and a very old hotel. Clean. Gemma and Rosa are pearls in a hectic city. Gemma helped retrieve a camera left in a taxi by calling the five central taxi agents. The hotel is now building an addition so next year it will be updated. This is old world Europe in a fantastic location. You can walk anywhere but the Vatican from here. The ancient airconditioning is a factor for summer guests who cannot take the heat. We had a front room which was very noisy. ( they provide ear plugs!) I love the breakfast of fruits, croissants, ham and cheese. The boys did not care for this type breakfast. The rooftop is only open for breakfast. A tiny elevator for one to two is adequate to take your bags to your room. The soaps are delightful. The shower is small.

Reviews.Title: “In the midst of acient Rome”
Reviews.Author: beachunter247
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location if you want to be in the historic center. Across the street from the Forum and a short walk to the Colosseum. Stayed with my family of four. The room was fine but the padded fabric walls were dingy and looked like the mildew had been cleaned off. We are out all day and just came in at night to sleep. The room would have been small to spend any time in. The staff was very helpful. Arranged for airport transportation and local taxis. Good neighborhood with lots of restaurant choices and plenty of gelato.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, elegant rooms, friendly staff, nice breakfast terrace”
Reviews.Author: SoCal-Traveler123
Reviews.Content: We chose Hotel Richmond for location first (walking distance from the Coliseum, Forum, Trevi Fountain and more), and price/star rating second. My family consists of 2 adults and 2 children (5 and 7 years old). The beautiful high-ceiling, wall-padded room and the stylish bathroom exceeded our expectations. The staff spoke many languages (English, French, some Spanish), and helped us a lot. They gave us advice on the best way to get to Vatican, on good local eateries, and other requests. We had a memorable breakfast on the 4th floor terrace watching the dawn turn into day over the hill opposite the Roman forum. The food and drinks were good and plentiful. Some rooms have no bathroom nor shower (not ours, because we requested a larger room to accomodate the entire family). For travelers considering rooms without these amenities, I looked into the shared bathroom and shower down the hall, and everything was spotless. That was reassuring. Hotels tend to be pricey in Rome, and Hotel Richmond is no exception. However, you get a good deal for the money. The photos include a view of inside our room and a view from our room looking outside towards the Roman forum (to the left).

Reviews.Title: “Loved the staff”
Reviews.Author: ketubahlady
Reviews.Content: This small hotel, with only 13 rooms, has the real antique atmosphere of Rome. It is very clean with modern bathrooms in the rooms. It has a friendly staff very willing to give directions. It also has a great location, right near the Colosseum and the Imperial Forum and not far from the Termini. The breakfast was very nice on the roof with a great view of Piazza Venezzia. I definitely would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Roma near the Ruins”
Reviews.Author: NatBriKen
Reviews.Content: After much review of the many types of hotels in Rome and the different areas they were located in we decided to stay at the Richmond Hotel in Rome. It is located on Via Cavour although the address says Corrado Ricci. It is across from Trajans Market and the Roman Forum, just down the block from the Colosseum and the Vittorio Emmanuele Monument. At night the area is all lit up. You can stroll among backlit history and still be close to the hotel. The room we booked was a standard but upon arrival we were upgraded to a suite which I later found out is the largest room in the hotel. It was extremely large by european standards. Well appointed marble bath included a tub with hand shower, double sinks, toilet, bidet and telephone. The room itself had a king size bed, sofa, two chairs, two end tables, desk with Television and telephone. The ceiling was exposed wood beams with stenciling. Buffet breakfast was included in the room rate and included breads, pastry, cheese, fruits, vegetables, coffee, capuccino, various teas, many juices and waters. The view from the rooftop restaurant was across the Roman Forum to the Vittorio Emanuele Monument. What a way to eat breakfast! When near the hotel during lunch or dinner times there were many restaurants to choose from. There were three just outside the door to the hotel. The one we frequented the most was the Trattoria Angelino Al Fori. If you eat outside under the Ivy covered canopy you can be serenaded by your opera singing waiter as he brings you your pasta and wine. Note, you are charged for bread so if that isn't your thing than say so. The only bad thing is that the other rooms in this hotel are smaller than the one I stayed in and some are even the size of large walk in closets with baths. Some don't have baths at all and you have to go down the hall to shower and use the facilities. However, this hotel is a gem and the staff is wonderful, the views are perfect and you can't beat the location. I HIGHLY recommend this hotel to all travellers to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel... great location”
Reviews.Author: snuffers
Reviews.Content: Paid 140 euros per night. Rooms were very clean! Staff was excellent... Fabio at the front desk was very nice!!! Great location, a block away from the colleseum and roman forum right across the street. Free continental breakfast on the rooftop was SWEET... fresh fruit, buns, cheese, meat, pound cake, cereal! Nice the hotel washroom provided body wash and shampoo too!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: ioio
Reviews.Content: Prices are too high for 2 stars and such service. Breakfast was good, but there is no restaurant in the hotel. The minibar in the room was nearly empty and when we asked if it's possible to order another coca-cola in our room, the answer was "no, sorry". Promised wireless internet didn't work, also air condition works in a very particular way.. By the way, in the shower I found little black bugs, that is really the most horrible. Doubtfully would recomend this hotel for someone.. and for sure will never come back there again. There is only one plus - really good central location, but there are a lot of other hotels around, it's better to choose something else.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Richmond”
Reviews.Author: dunmore2
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this delightful hotel for 2 nights in July. The staff was friendly and helpful. Their English was fluent and they answered our many questions from shoe shopping to getting us a taxi. The breakfast was better than most in Italy, croissants, fruit, cheese, cereal, yogurt, cold meat ,fresh juices and the best view in the whole city. The room was spacious with very good quality bed linens. We will stay here again for all of the above reasons plus the location is perfect. The pizza place just out the front door is also recommended by us. We ate there twice, great food, fair prices.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and staff, but...”
Reviews.Author: Ralph2211
Reviews.Content: Couldn't fault the hotel. Helpful, friendly, courteous, pleasant, etc, etc. Rooms basic but spotless. Loads of reasonably priced and excellent restaurants, trattoria, etc just outside the front door. Breakfast very good and with lovely view of Roman Forum and Basilica of Maxentius. We had a fabulous visit - BUT - they almost ruined it all on the way home! We requested a taxi to take us to the airport (in the same way we had requested several taxis during our stay). The young man on reception did not request the same taxi firm as had been hired before, but a private cab. The lady driver refused to give us a price for the journey and claimed she did not understand our attempts to ask for a price, which soon changed once we arrived at the airport... Journey cost us nearly DOUBLE our journey to the hotel. Lesson: book a taxi yourself or get the bus!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Richmond Hotel takes great care of its guests. I arrived at the hotel with my wife and two teenage sons after just being scammed by a Rome taxi out of about 60 Euros. I mentioned this to Rosa while checking in and she asked if I had the number of the taxi, which I did. A few hours later, I learned that Rosa had tracked down the driver. The next day, the driver came to the hotel and returned the 60 Euro he owed me plus the cost of the cab ride. Rosa is a gem. The hotel itself is in a very great location (next to the Roman Forum and a block from the Coliseum) and my room (102) was clean, quiet and comfortable for the four of us. The breakfast was very good and the rooftop location was a real treat. I would definitely stay at the Richmond Hotel again.
